Getting started with sgpFlowMatrices

Damian W Betebenner

Introduction

The R package sgpFlowMatrices contains sgpFlow coefficient matrices for use with the sgpFlow package in calculating percentile growth trajectories. The package is under active development by staff at the Center for Assessment.

Contents

The baseline coefficient matrices embedded in sgpFlowMatrices are updated periodically. Current contents include:

  • DEMO_sgpFlowMatrices: Contains single-cohort (2023-2024) and super-cohort (2020-2021 to 2023-2024) matrices DEMO based upon sgpDataLONG.

Use of sgpFlowMatrices

After installing the package from GitHub, one conducts baseline SGP calculations with the matrices in this package. Baseline matrices are added to the SGPstateData object embedded in the SGP prior to running SGP analyses supply the appropriate state abbreviation and year to the addMatrices function. For example:

SGPstateData <- sgpFlowMatrices::addMatrices("DEMO", "SUPER_COHORT", "2023_2024")

Examples 

SGPstateData <- sgpFlowMatrices::addMatrices("DEMO", "Single-Cohort", add.matrices.to.which.state="DEMO")

Contributions & Requests

If you have contributions of baseline matrices or a feature request for the sgpFlowMatrices package, don’t hesitate to write or set up an issue on GitHub.

sgpFlowMatrices is a Center for Assessment thing.
